intro: Alloplectus eriocalyx, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance, and its flowers are small and yellow, resembling those of true dandelions. Alloplectus eriocalyx is often mistaken for other similar species due to its appearance and habitat preferences.
